meanings.definition: To move or cause to move into a sloping position.
meanings.sent1: She tilts her head to the side to listen better.
meanings.sent2: The ship tilts slightly as it turns around the corner.
meanings.sent3: The curious puppy tilts its head in confusion at the strange noise.
meanings.sent4: The tower of blocks tilts dangerously before collapsing.
meanings.sent5: The old bookshelf tilts under the weight of too many books.

meanings.sent1: The painting on the wall hangs at a slight tilt.
meanings.sent2: The playground slide has a fun tilt at the end.
meanings.sent3: The leaning tower has a famous tilt that attracts tourists.
meanings.sent4: The tilt of the hill makes it perfect for sledding in winter.
meanings.sent5: The tilt of the sun in the evening creates beautiful shadows.

meanings.definition: A combat between two knights in medieval times.
meanings.sent1: The jousting tilt at the fair reenacts medieval battles.
meanings.sent2: The knights prepare for the tilt in their shining armor.
meanings.sent3: The crowd cheers as the knights charge at each other in the tilt.
meanings.sent4: The tilt between the two knights determines the victor of the tournament.
meanings.sent5: The tilt is a thrilling spectacle of bravery and skill.
